block.p: Mary Elizabeth Vito and Christopher John Fay were married yesterday at Trinity Episcopal Church in Newport, R.I. The Rev. Peter Lane performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Fay, 35, is known as Beth. She is the vice president for marketing of Online Retail Partners, a New York company that puts businesses online. She graduated cum laude from Rice University and received an M.B.A. degree from Stanford University. She is a daughter of Barbara and Carmine A. Vito of Austin, Tex. Her father, a retired Air Force colonel and U-2 pilot, flew missions into the Soviet Union in the 1950's. Her mother, also retired, was a chef and owner of the now-defunct Eagle's Nest Cafe in Austin.
Mary Elizabeth Vito and Christopher John Fay were married yesterday at Trinity Episcopal Church in Newport, R.I. The Rev. Peter Lane performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Fay, 35, is known as Beth. She is the vice president for marketing of Online Retail Partners, a New York company that puts businesses online. She graduated cum laude from Rice University and received an M.B.A. degree from Stanford University. She is a daughter of Barbara and Carmine A. Vito of Austin, Tex. Her father, a retired Air Force colonel and U-2 pilot, flew missions into the Soviet Union in the 1950's. Her mother, also retired, was a chef and owner of the now-defunct Eagle's Nest Cafe in Austin.

Mr. Fay, 38, is the president of Greenwich Strategy Consulting in Connecticut. He graduated from Brown University and received an M.B.A. from Harvard University. He is a son of Dorothy Ryan Fay of Greenwich and George F. Fay of Norwalk, Conn. His mother is a real estate broker with the Coldwell Banker office in Greenwich. His father retired as an operations manager of the General Foods Corporation in White Plains.
